Package arcade.sim

Class HexGrowthSim

java.lang.Object
sim.engine.SimState
arcade.sim.GrowthSimulation
arcade.sim.HexGrowthSim
All Implemented Interfaces:
Simulation, java.io.Serializable
public class HexGrowthSim
extends GrowthSimulation
Extension of GrowthSimulation for hexagonal geometry.

Cell agents exist on a hexagonal grid and molecules in the environment diffuse on a triangular lattice, such that each hexagon corresponds to 6 triangles. The hexagonal locations are defined in the (u, v, w, z) coordinate space such that (0,0,0,0) is the hexagon in the center of the simulation. The triangular locations are defined in the (x, y, z) coordinate space such that (0,0,0) is the triangle in the top left of the center slice of the simulation. Because environment radius is guaranteed to be even, the top left triangle of the corresponding triangular lattices is always pointed down.

Since:
2.0
Version:
2.3.9
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • HexGrowthSim

      public HexGrowthSim​(long seed, Series series)
      GrowthSimulation with hexagonal geometry.

      Passes Series to HexLocation to update static configuration variables for the entire simulation. Length, width, and depth of the triangular lattice are calculated based on radius and height of the hexagonal grid.

      Parameters:
      seed - the random seed for random number generator
      series - the simulation series

    • getSpanLocations

      public Location[][][] getSpanLocations()
      Gets the lattice coordinates that span the environment.

      Spanning locations use the hexagons aligned with the axes, i.e., all (u, v, w) for which one of the values is zero.

      Returns:
      an array of coordinates

    • getCenterLocation

      public Location getCenterLocation()
      Gets the center location of the simulation.

      Center location in hexagonal grid located at (0,0,0,0).

      Returns:
      the center locations

    • getLocationSet

      private static HexLocation[] getLocationSet​(int r, int z)
      Returns the axis-aligned locations for a given radius.
      Parameters:
      r - the radius from the center of the environment
      z - the z axis coordinate
      Returns:
      the list of locations

    • getInitLocations

      public java.util.ArrayList<Location> getInitLocations​(int radius)
      Gets a list of initialization locations for the given bounds.

      Includes locations in an approximate sphere of the given radius. For 2D simulations (height = 1), includes locations within a circle of the given radius.

      Parameters:
      radius - the bound on the initialization radius
      Returns:
      a list of locations
